column4: Hello, on ubuntu software center i do not find xchat. so I am installing it from source. I have never encountered this problem(i am on ubuntu netbook remix) when i ./configure i get: http://pastie.org/1002945   do I not have gcc or cc that i need?

sudo apt-get install build-essential
use &&
you may have to enable the universe repo in software sources
quit hammering enter after every word too
i have not been

my bad. you can see where i mixed up
sorry
mousty isnt me
if you add a startup item to replace the WM at startup it will be fine
add an entry in startup items to run:   openbox --replace     or whatever WM you wish to use
--replace closes what it uses?
is this the WM:  Netbook Launcher  A Clutter-based desktop launcher   or if i run a different WM this will still open? in startup apps i do not see the current WM
the WM will simply run alongside the NBR. You need to choose the gnome desktop instead of the netbook launcher just before login. Click your username then look at the bottom of the screen
do i need to logoff and close all my open apps to go back and select a different WM on the login screen?
my .dmrc doesn't have that in dude, you usually set the desktop when you log in
my .dmrc has Session=gnome, I am trying to avoid doing it the graphical way, also what if i want to change the display manager to xfce's default display manager
well, its free to try. You can always re-edit the file
